title: LEAP: Enhancing Vision-Based Occupancy Networks with Lightweight Spatio-Temporal Correlation
author: Fengcheng Yu (Sun Yat-sen University), Haoran Xu (Sun Yat-sen University), Canming Xia (Sun Yat-sen University), Guang Tan (Sun Yat-sen University), ...
background: The paper presents a method to improve occupancy prediction in the context of autonomous driving by incorporating both current and historical visual information.
contribution: This paper introduces the Lightweight Spatio-Temporal Correlation (LEAP) method to solve the issues of accuracy in occupancy networks caused by limited visual cues and occlusions, achieving significant improvements in prediction accuracy and efficiency.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Prior occupancy prediction methods mainly utilized either 3D viewing alone or integrated 4D temporal information, but faced challenges in accuracy due to occlusion and redundancy in feature representation.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by integrating a tri-stream fusion architecture which effectively captures correlations between spatial and temporal features without incurring excessive computational overhead.

key_innovation: LEAP combines static and motion features into a compact latent space, enhancing the accuracy of existing occupancy networks while maintaining low computational costs.
real_world_impact: By improving the predictive capabilities in dynamic environments like autonomous driving, this research could lead to more reliable navigation systems, enhancing safety and efficiency on the roads.
limitations: The authors did not explicitly mention limitations.

new_terms.Spatio-Temporal Correlation: **Spatio-Temporal Correlation** refers to the relationship between spatial and temporal features, aimed at capturing how data points change over space and time to improve predictions.
new_terms.Tri-Stream Fusion: **Tri-Stream Fusion** is an architectural design that processes three different input streams through separate pathways before merging their learned features, ensuring richer information integration.
